thread.title: Sophie Melville to star in Orange Tree Theatre's revival of feminist classic Low Level Panic
thread.title_full: Sophie Melville to star in Orange Tree Theatre's revival of feminist classic Low Level Panic

author: Jessie Thompson
title: Sophie Melville to star in Orange Tree Theatre's revival of feminist classic Low Level Panic
text:
Jessie Thompson Wednesday 4 January 2017 11:22 BST Feminist classic: Sophie Melville, pictured at the Evening Standard Theatre Awards, will star in Low Level Panic Dave Benett Sophie Melville, who was shortlisted for last year’s Evening Standard Theatre Award for Best Actress, will star in the Orange Tree Theatre’s revival of Clare McIntyre’s Low Level Panic. Melville, who was nominated for her performance in Gary Owen’s Iphigenia in Splott , will star as Mary in the feminist three-hander which explores the effects of society’s objectification of women. She will be joined by Katherine Pearce, who performed in DH Lawrence adaptation Husbands and Sons at the National Theatre, and Samantha Pearl, recently seen in Belarus Free Theatre’s Tomorrow I Was Always a Lion. The production will be directed by 2016 JMK Award runner-up Chelsea Walker, who is part of The Old Vic 12 and has previously directed at the Finborough Theatre and Southwark Playhouse. 20 theatre shows not to miss in 2017 McIntyre, who passed away in 2009, won the Evening Standard’s Most Promising Playwright in 1990 for My Heart’s a Suitcase. This is the first major revival of Low Level Panic since its premiere at the Royal Court in 1988. 
Low Level Panic is at the Orange Tree Theatre from February 12 - March 26; orangetreetheatre.co.uk 
Visit standard.co.uk/theatre for the latest news and reviews from London’s theatre scene.
